revised_title: Immunological Tolerance in Newborn Animals: Induction and Analysis
tldr: The authors discuss the induction of immunological tolerance in newborn animals, focusing on methods to successfully create tolerance in mice and chicks. They explore different techniques for introducing foreign cells and analyze the effectiveness of various methods, including intravenous injection and transplantation of skin. The research aims to understand the mechanisms of tolerance and its implications for organ transplantation and immunology.
